column26: Illumina NovaSeq 6000 sequencing; Transcriptomes and differential gene expression analysis of the Arabidopsis cells that received type-III effectors delivered by Xanthomonas campestris pv. Campestris (Xcc) bacterial mutants
column27: Transcriptomes and differential gene expression analysis of the Arabidopsis cells that received type-III effectors delivered by Xanthomonas campestris pv. Campestris (Xcc) bacterial mutants
column28: Illumina NovaSeq 6000 sequencing; Transcriptomes and differential gene expression analysis of the Arabidopsis cells that received type-III effectors delivered by Xanthomonas campestris pv. Campestris (Xcc) bacterial mutants
column29: Protocols: INTABE-reporter Arabidopsis transgenic lines were inoculated with Xcc* (strain 8004∆avrAC∆xopAM avrBs3) or Xcc*∆xopD (strain 8004∆avrAC∆xopAM∆xopD avrBs3), respectively, using wound inoculation of the main leaf vein. Inoculated leave samples were collected at 5 DPI, and nuclei of the cells that have received Xcc* effectors with or without XopD were isolated from Xcc*- and Xcc*△xopD-infected leaves, respectively, by the INTACT method. Plants were grown on soil in a growth chamber under short-day conditions (8 hours of light and 16 hours of dark, a light fluence rate of 125 to 175 μmol m−2 s−1, relative humidity 65%) at 22°C for 4 weeks. Two days before bacterial infection assays, the plants were transferred to another short-day growth chamber at 25°C, and the infected plants were kept in the same chamber.  Nuclear RNA was extracted from nonfixed nuclei using the RNeasy Plus Micro Kit (Qiagen) and further treated with DNase I (Thermo Fisher Scientific) to remove any contaminating genomic DNA, following the manufacturer instructions. The SMARTer Ultra Low Input RNA for Illumina Sequencing-HV kit (Clontech) was used for double-stranded cDNA synthesis from ∼500 pg nuclear RNA, and subsequently the Low Input Library Prep Kit (Clontech) was used for preparation of sequencing libraries, according to the manufacturer’s instructions.
